alert.note: Alert for Olmsted; Wabasha (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 13 at 9:09AM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Olmsted and Wabasha Counties through 1000 AM CDT... At 909 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Mazeppa, or 15 miles north of Rochester, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Kellogg around 945 AM CDT. Wabasha around 950 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include South Troy, Pioneer Campground, Rattelsnake Point, Potsdam, Hidden Meadows R V Park, West Albany, County Roads 33 And 4, Kings Park, Bremen and Theilman. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
